intro: Triticum vulgare var. cladura, commonly known as the clubgrass, is a grass species characterized by its distinctive club-shaped inflorescence. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, two-lobed flowers. This variety is often found in meadows, riverbanks, and disturbed sites, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
